Stem: Triangular or crescent-shaped in cross-section. Hollow when young. Release a milky sap when cut, which turns black.
Leaves: Dark green on top, hairy and white to grey underneath. Very large up to 60 cm long. With deep lobes. Alternate along stems.
Flowers: Small, yellowish-green, in clusters forming cylindrical spikes. Male flower spikes drooping, female spikes erect.
FruitSeeds: Small, inconspiculous, fleshy, oval-shaped. In cylindrical clusters 9-12 cm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Can look like Pawpaw (*Carica papaya*) but has whiter leaf undersides and smaller fruit.
